dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Waller b Panyangara 68 (67b 7x4 1x6 81m) SR: 101.49

dismissalComment.html: upper-cut straight to deep point. That's a lucky break for Zimbabwe. This is short and wide, but he has found the fielder with it

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Taylor b Chatara 38 (66b 3x4 0x6 94m) SR: 57.57

dismissalComment.html: Chatara strikes. The extra pace does it for Mominul who has been scratching around. Wide length ball, clearly late into the drive, edges it through. Hang on. We are checking the no-ball. What a waste of time. He is nowhere close to over-stepping. More than half his foot is behind the line. That's his first ODI wicket

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: strangle down the leg side. No dissent from Tamim. Short of a length, pitches leg, moves back in, Tamim looks to play it fine, gets too fine a touch, and Taylor takes a good diving catch

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: what a soft dismissal. Masakadza gets another wicket with a delivery down the leg side. On a length, on the pads, Ashraful can't resist lofting it. Finds the only man in the deep square on the leg side

another wicket chucked away. Or is it? Mushfiqur is not too please walking away. Full, wide, half-volley, Mushfiqur doesn't get close to the line of the ball but still drives at it. Gets the edge, and is taken. Mushfiqur seems to be suggesting it might have been a bump ball. Replays show no such thing
slower ball, beats the almighty heave from Mahmudullah. Knocks back the off stump with one from the back of the hand. He has four now. And four balls left to try to take a maiden five-for

Chatara strikes. The extra pace does it for Mominul who has been scratching around. Wide length ball, clearly late into the drive, edges it through. Hang on. We are checking the no-ball. What a waste of time. He is nowhere close to over-stepping. More than half his foot is behind the line. That's his first ODI wicket

headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: nearly drops it. Ziaur's ungainly stay comes to an end. He charges at Chatara, lofts down the ground, connects well, but these are no Mickey-Mouse boundaries, and Chakabva gets under an easy catch. The ball bursts through to hit his chest, but he collects the rebound

dismissalComment.html: what a soft dismissal. Masakadza gets another wicket with a delivery down the leg side. On a length, on the pads, Ashraful can't resist lofting it. Finds the only man in the deep square on the leg side

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Taylor b SW Masakadza 5 (13b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 38.46

dismissalComment.html: another wicket chucked away. Or is it? Mushfiqur is not too please walking away. Full, wide, half-volley, Mushfiqur doesn't get close to the line of the ball but still drives at it. Gets the edge, and is taken. Mushfiqur seems to be suggesting it might have been a bump ball. Replays show no such thing

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan run out (Waller) 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh keep throwing away wickets. A strange little innings from Shakib comes to an end. Shakib keeps walking across and down the wicket for some reason, gets an inside edge onto the pad, which rolls towards point. Mominul wants the single, but Shakib is sending him back, and then for some reason he makes a late decision to go for it. Too late to go back now as Waller underarms the only stump visible to send him back. Poor batting continues

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Taylor b Chatara 38 (66b 3x4 0x6 94m) SR: 57.57

dismissalComment.html: Chatara strikes. The extra pace does it for Mominul who has been scratching around. Wide length ball, clearly late into the drive, edges it through. Hang on. We are checking the no-ball. What a waste of time. He is nowhere close to over-stepping. More than half his foot is behind the line. That's his first ODI wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza lbw b Ziaur Rahman 38 (53b 3x4 1x6 86m) SR: 71.69

dismissalComment.html: this is dead plumb. Maskadza has finally fallen. Bangladesh sense the win now. Masakadza walks down the wicket, but Zia gets it to swing in from outside off, and hits him in front. Not the best of shots

dismissalText.commentary: Shingi Masakadza lbw b Robiul Islam 33 (33b 3x4 2x6 46m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: it's over. Robiul gets the wicket with a full and straight delivery. This hits him middle and leg, and would have taken leg

image.caption: Ziaur Rahman portrait
image.longCaption: Ziaur Rahman portrait, World Twenty20, September 14, 2012

headshotImage.caption: Zaiur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: this is dead plumb. Maskadza has finally fallen. Bangladesh sense the win now. Masakadza walks down the wicket, but Zia gets it to swing in from outside off, and hits him in front. Not the best of shots
horrible slog across the line. Zia bowls on a length, on off, he swipes across the line. Off stump goes for a walk. Elton can keep his high-tea appointment now

another wicket gone. Hold on. They are checking if the catch is clean. This was short of a length, and wide, and he has punched this uppishly towards point. We are going to check the replays, which are not conclusive with this coverage. You cannot tell anything at all if it has been caught on a half-volley or on the full. Mominul is confident. This replay will give the batsman the benefit of the doubt. One day, I will like to see an umpire say I was watching and I know what happened. Especially with such a challenged coverage. Oh surprise surprise. They have given this
and finally the slog gets Bangladesh the wicket. This partnership much have frustrated Bangladesh, but Zia has come back and broken through. Waller swipes across the line, and misses, and is bowled

that's five for Zia. he began the day with an average for 100. What a game cricket is. This one nips back in from a length just outside off, and traps him dead in front. Can Zia finish this off with a hat-trick?

dismissalComment.html: bowled'im. As has been the norm today, another wicket has been gifted. This is wide, on a length, Chakabva pushes at it away from the body, gets an inside edge onto the stumps

Islam is on fire. Butt's debut has not ended well. That's full and fast, Butt has closed the face a touch to play it to leg, and the ball has jagged back in after pitching to knock the middle stump out of the ground

dismissalComment.html: off stump out of the ground. Razzak does it with the non-turner. Short of a length, outside off, this one goes on with the arm, beats the inside edge by a long way, and the top of off is hit. Timbah

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams run out (Abdur Razzak/Mushfiqur Rahim) 10 (11b 1x4 0x6 19m) SR: 90.9

dismissalComment.html: given without replays. Down the wicket, pushes this to cover, goes through for the non-existent single. The throw is quick if not all that accurate, and Mushfiqur does well with the collection and the breaking of the wicket

headshotImage.caption: Zaiur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shingi Masakadza lbw b Robiul Islam 33 (33b 3x4 2x6 46m) SR: 100

commentTextItems.html: it's over. Robiul gets the wicket with a full and straight delivery. This hits him middle and leg, and would have taken leg

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all we have from today. The second game is on Sunday, 9am Bulawayo time. Do join us then. Cheers

"Shocker," says Brendan Taylor. "Very disappointing. We were happy restricting them to 268 on a flat wicket, but we didn't bat well. No room for excuses. We have got to come back well. It's such a good wicket. We kept finding ways to get out. it is frustrating. Bangladesh kept it really simple. We can learn from them. Not much time. Tomorrow practice, and come out and be positive and back ourselves. They are going to be tough to beat, but we will be up for that."

"Always happy with such wins," says Mushfiqur Rahim. "It is an important match because this is the series opener. We lost a few wickets, but Nasir and Mominul and Mahmudullah batted really well. Shows Nasir is in good form. It is a pleasure to play with him. He and Mominul put up a crucial partnership. Shafiul took early wickets, and we knew it was a matter of one or two wickets when they got that partnership going. And Zia bowled superbly."

"First of all I thank Allah," says Ziaur Rahman, the Man of the Match. "I was looking to bowl straight, just bowl line and length. Everybody supported me. Beautiful country. I am enjoying the stay here."

Shakib plucks out a stump for Ziaur Rahman, who came into the match with an average of 100, but has taken five wickets to skittle out Zimbabwe. That's a big win by 121 runs after being put in. A solid innings from Nasir Hossain set them up after Bangladesh had been 94 for 4 at one stage. After that, their bowlers, no longer relying on just spin, put the hosts under a lot of pressure, and reaped the wickets

"Our boys played really really well," says Abdur Razzak. "We batted well first, and then bowled really well. When I started the career, we have been playing more ODIs than Tests so we enjoy the format. We will try to play similar kind of cricket in the coming matches."

commentTextItems.html: another appeal for lbw. A smiliar delivery really except that this one has taken the inside edge

commentPreTextItems.html: Chatara to face the hat-trick ball. Two slips, a short cover,a  gully catching

commentTextItems.html: how close has he come to a hat-trick? He had it, for mine, but the big stride from Chatara seems to have saved him. This was straight, just short of a length, seamed in, and trapped him in front. Not given. I can only imagine the stride saved him

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara lbw b Ziaur Rahman 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

commentPreTextItems.html: Panyangara is the new man in

commentTextItems.html: that's five for Zia. he began the day with an average for 100. What a game cricket is. This one nips back in from a length just outside off, and traps him dead in front. Can Zia finish this off with a hat-trick?

commentPreTextItems.html: AndrewM: "Just back on, after a coffee delay (Salvadorian coffee amongst the best in the world!) and its all rather depressing. Shingi has done himself proud recently though, i remember Allan Donald singling him out for praise during his brief coaching stint in Zim. Would love it if these 2 could get 50 each..."

commentTextItems.html: and finally the slog gets Bangladesh the wicket. This partnership much have frustrated Bangladesh, but Zia has come back and broken through. Waller swipes across the line, and misses, and is bowled

commentPostTextItems.html: Time for the final drink of the afternoon

commentTextItems.html: on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
appeal for lbw as this one nips back in, but Masakadza has got outside the line of off

commentPreTextItems.html: "Its Yowerere Yave Nyama Yekugocha Baya wabaya" Thanks, Chris. And I have just spotted Ashraful dancing along

full, outside off, driven to sweeper-cover

full, on off, defended to cover
pushed to sweeper-cover for one
full, on off, defended with an open face

on a length, angling in towards off, defended off the back foot

hooked away. That's some shot. He has taken this bouncer from well outside off, and smacked it over midwicket

commentPreTextItems.html: Jambe: "Can Shingi and Malcom keep us interested in this match? IThey hold the key to whether I will be drinking out of sorrow or celebration tonight. So far it looks like sorrow-driven drinkig..."

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh keep throwing away wickets. A strange little innings from Shakib comes to an end. Shakib keeps walking across and down the wicket for some reason, gets an inside edge onto the pad, which rolls towards point. Mominul wants the single, but Shakib is sending him back, and then for some reason he makes a late decision to go for it. Too late to go back now as Waller underarms the only stump visible to send him back. Poor batting continues

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Waller b Panyangara 68 (67b 7x4 1x6 81m) SR: 101.49

dismissalComment.html: upper-cut straight to deep point. That's a lucky break for Zimbabwe. This is short and wide, but he has found the fielder with it

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b SW Masakadza 36 (38b 3x4 0x6 57m) SR: 94.73

dismissalComment.html: slower ball, beats the almighty heave from Mahmudullah. Knocks back the off stump with one from the back of the hand. He has four now. And four balls left to try to take a maiden five-for

image.longCaption: Ziaur Rahman portrait, World Twenty20, September 14, 2012

dismissalText.commentary: Ziaur Rahman c Chakabva b Chatara 12 (10b 2x4 0x6 14m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: nearly drops it. Ziaur's ungainly stay comes to an end. He charges at Chatara, lofts down the ground, connects well, but these are no Mickey-Mouse boundaries, and Chakabva gets under an easy catch. The ball bursts through to hit his chest, but he collects the rebound

dismissalComment.html: Chatara strikes. The extra pace does it for Mominul who has been scratching around. Wide length ball, clearly late into the drive, edges it through. Hang on. We are checking the no-ball. What a waste of time. He is nowhere close to over-stepping. More than half his foot is behind the line. That's his first ODI wicket

upper-cut straight to deep point. That's a lucky break for Zimbabwe. This is short and wide, but he has found the fielder with it

dismissalComment.html: strangle down the leg side. No dissent from Tamim. Short of a length, pitches leg, moves back in, Tamim looks to play it fine, gets too fine a touch, and Taylor takes a good diving catch

dismissalComment.html: what a soft dismissal. Masakadza gets another wicket with a delivery down the leg side. On a length, on the pads, Ashraful can't resist lofting it. Finds the only man in the deep square on the leg side

another wicket chucked away. Or is it? Mushfiqur is not too please walking away. Full, wide, half-volley, Mushfiqur doesn't get close to the line of the ball but still drives at it. Gets the edge, and is taken. Mushfiqur seems to be suggesting it might have been a bump ball. Replays show no such thing
slower ball, beats the almighty heave from Mahmudullah. Knocks back the off stump with one from the back of the hand. He has four now. And four balls left to try to take a maiden five-for

headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza lbw b Ziaur Rahman 38 (53b 3x4 1x6 86m) SR: 71.69

dismissalComment.html: this is dead plumb. Maskadza has finally fallen. Bangladesh sense the win now. Masakadza walks down the wicket, but Zia gets it to swing in from outside off, and hits him in front. Not the best of shots

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva b Shafiul Islam 1 (7b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: bowled'im. As has been the norm today, another wicket has been gifted. This is wide, on a length, Chakabva pushes at it away from the body, gets an inside edge onto the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza b Shafiul Islam 3 (6b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Islam is on fire. Butt's debut has not ended well. That's full and fast, Butt has closed the face a touch to play it to leg, and the ball has jagged back in after pitching to knock the middle stump out of the ground

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor b Abdur Razzak 33 (37b 4x4 0x6 47m) SR: 89.18

dismissalComment.html: off stump out of the ground. Razzak does it with the non-turner. Short of a length, outside off, this one goes on with the arm, beats the inside edge by a long way, and the top of off is hit. Timbah

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams run out (Abdur Razzak/Mushfiqur Rahim) 10 (11b 1x4 0x6 19m) SR: 90.9

dismissalComment.html: given without replays. Down the wicket, pushes this to cover, goes through for the non-existent single. The throw is quick if not all that accurate, and Mushfiqur does well with the collection and the breaking of the wicket

image.caption: Ziaur Rahman portrait
image.longCaption: Ziaur Rahman portrait, World Twenty20, September 14, 2012

headshotImage.caption: Zaiur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller b Ziaur Rahman 19 (38b 1x4 0x6 54m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: and finally the slog gets Bangladesh the wicket. This partnership much have frustrated Bangladesh, but Zia has come back and broken through. Waller swipes across the line, and misses, and is bowled

image.caption: Ziaur Rahman portrait
image.longCaption: Ziaur Rahman portrait, World Twenty20, September 14, 2012

headshotImage.caption: Zaiur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura b Ziaur Rahman 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: horrible slog across the line. Zia bowls on a length, on off, he swipes across the line. Off stump goes for a walk. Elton can keep his high-tea appointment now

image.caption: Ziaur Rahman portrait
image.longCaption: Ziaur Rahman portrait, World Twenty20, September 14, 2012

headshotImage.caption: Zaiur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaiur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mominul Haque b Ziaur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Prosper Utseya c Mominul Haque b Ziaur Rahman 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: another wicket gone. Hold on. They are checking if the catch is clean. This was short of a length, and wide, and he has punched this uppishly towards point. We are going to check the replays, which are not conclusive with this coverage. You cannot tell anything at all if it has been caught on a half-volley or on the full. Mominul is confident. This replay will give the batsman the benefit of the doubt. One day, I will like to see an umpire say I was watching and I know what happened. Especially with such a challenged coverage. Oh surprise surprise. They have given this

image.caption: Shingirai Masakadza
image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.longCaption: Shingirai Masakadza portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Shingi Masakadza lbw b Robiul Islam 33 (33b 3x4 2x6 46m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: it's over. Robiul gets the wicket with a full and straight delivery. This hits him middle and leg, and would have taken leg

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara lbw b Ziaur Rahman 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: that's five for Zia. he began the day with an average for 100. What a game cricket is. This one nips back in from a length just outside off, and traps him dead in front. Can Zia finish this off with a hat-trick?

Drinks: Bangladesh - 75/2 in 15.4 overs (Mominul Haque 3)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 22.4 overs (136 balls), Extras 23
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 57 balls (Mominul Haque 16, Nasir Hossain 28, Ex 6)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 32.5 overs (197 balls), Extras 26
Drinks: Bangladesh - 164/4 in 35.0 overs (Mominul Haque 37, Nasir Hossain 39)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 27 runs, 1 wicket)
Nasir Hossain: 50 off 50 balls (6 x 4)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 40.6 overs (246 balls), Extras 29
Bangladesh: 250 runs in 47.6 overs (288 balls), Extras 34
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 269/8 in 50.0 overs (Abdur Razzak 16, Shafiul Islam 1)

Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 54 runs, 2 wickets)
Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 9.5 overs (60 balls), Extras 7
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 50 balls (H Masakadza 23, BRM Taylor 23, Ex 4)
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 87/3 in 17.0 overs (H Masakadza 37, SC Williams 5)
Zimbabwe: 100 runs in 24.2 overs (148 balls), Extras 9
8th Wicket: 50 runs in 58 balls (MN Waller 19, SW Masakadza 31, Ex 2)
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 148/8 in 31.3 overs (SW Masakadza 33)

stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Bulawayo
